devdoc.details: See IRewardChefV2 interface for full details.*

params.amountEDecimal: Quantity without taking into account the multiplier that we will subtract
params.to: User for whom we will subtract the virtual balance

params.amountEDecimal: Quantity without taking into account the multiplier that we will subtract
params.to: User who will decrease his deposit amount

harvest(address,address,uint256).details: Here we send msg.sender pendingSushi to {to} and update lockup period.

params.amountEDecimal: Quantity without taking into account the multiplier that we will add
params.lockupPeriodSeconds: Current deposit lockup period. Can't increase amount with 2 different lockupPeriods
params.to: User for whom we will increase the virtual balance

returns.pending: REWARD_TOKEN reward for a given user.

refillReward(uint256,uint64).details: admin transfer REWARD_TOKEN to contract to increase rewards per block

params.to: The address of the user whose information will be cleared

rewardsBetweenBlocks(uint256,uint256).details: returns total amount of rewards allocated to the all pools on the rage (startBlock, endBlock] i.e. excluding startBlock but including endBlock

setPossibleLockupPeriodsSeconds(uint256,.details: If multiplicator1e18 == 0 => we remove lockupPeriodSeconds else we add it

params.lockupPeriodSeconds: Amount of seconds of lockupPeriod we want to add/remove

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[EIP section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

totalAllocPoint.details: Total allocation points. Must be the sum of all allocation points in all pools. The good practice, to always keep this variable is equal 1000.

devdoc.title: RewardChefV2

add(uint256,address).notice: Add a new reward pool. Can only be called by the admin. Can't add the same LP token more than once.

decreaseAmount(address,address,uint256).notice: Analogues to MVC2 Withdraw method, that can be called only by trusted address (onlyRewardAccess) that is trusted to honestly calc how many "virtual" tokens have to be allocated for each user.

getDecreaseAmountRewardPenalty(address,a.notice: View method that return penalty for user that will decrease amount by {amountEDecimal}

getPoolApr(address).notice: Method for frontend that return pool APR in base of 1e18

getPossibleLockupPeriodsSeconds().notice: view method that return all lockupPeriods in ILockupPeriod struct

harvest(address,address,uint256).notice: Harvest proceeds for transaction sender to {to}.

increaseAmount(address,address,uint256,u.notice: analogues to MCV2 Deposit method, but can be called only by trusted address (onlyRewardAccess) that is trusted to honestly calc how many "virtual" tokens have to be allocated for each user.

pendingSushi(address,address).notice: View function to see pending REWARD_TOKEN on frontend.

poolInfo(address).notice: Info of each MCV2 pool. SuDAO: instead of pool Ids (pid) we use address of the asset directly. Also, there aren't just LPs but regular assets as well*

resetAmount(address,address).notice: Withdraw without caring about rewards. EMERGENCY ONLY.

set(address,uint256).notice: Update the given pool's REWARD_TOKEN allocation point. Can only be called by the admin. Can't be called for asset that was not added by add() function.

setPossibleLockupPeriodsSeconds(uint256,.notice: method to add new LockupPeriods with it multiplicator

updateAllPools().notice: Update reward variables for all pools. Be careful of gas spending!

updatePool(address).notice: Update reward variables of the given pool.

userInfo(address,address).notice: Info of each user that stakes tokens. userInfo[_asset][_user]*
